title: “Nice view and great concierge”
text: My mom and I stayed two nights last week. Great view from our corner room of the river and the city. Room was super clean and had lots of pillows! The evening concierge that was there was unreal! I wish I had his name! He was so knowledgable about everything Philly. He suggested restaurants and tours and was wonderful. My only two complaints are paying $25 a day to park and $10 a day for wifi. You pay that much for a room and they still want money for two necessities ? Drives me crazy! The hotel is minutes away from all the main tourist stuff. Easy walk to liberty bell etc.

title: “Besser als erwartet”
text:
Wir haben dieses Hotel mit leichten Bauchschmerzen gebucht,vor allem,nachdem wir die ganzen Bewertungen gelesen haben.Besonders Panik hatten wir vor Bettwanzen und den Dreck in den Zimmern.Wir hatten also eigene Bettwäsche und Latschen im Gepäck.
Das Hotel ist von der Lage wie beschrieben:absoluter Hammer,der Times Square ist 100m entfernt,Subwaystation in 5 min zu erreichen,super!!!
Wir betraten unser Zimmer im 14.Stock und es war wie befürchtet:Mülltüte im Zimmer,Bett nicht gemacht und dreckige Handtücher auf dem Boden,nach langem Flug und 24 Stunden wach sein nicht besonders lustig.Sind also zur Rezeption und erklärten unser Anliegen,der Mitarbeiter entschuldigte sich mehrmals,gab uns sofort ein neues Zimmer und wir bezogen daraufhin unser sauberes Zimmer,mit gemachten Betten und frischen Handtüchern:-)
Es wird in dem Hotel ständig gemalert und renoviert,weswegen die Schimmelflecken an der Decke im Bad nur schwach durchschimmern und somit auch völlig ok sind,ein grober Blick auf die Matratzen war auch ok,keine Bettwanzenüberreste gefunden und da wir eigene Bettwäsche hatten,war es ok,das Bett selber schlief sich herrlich,der Boden war eigentlich ok,haben aber Latschen getragen.Das Zimmer wurde vom Hauspersonal einmal in 6 Tagen gereinigt und das war ausreichend.
Alles in allem war es ein geniales Hotel was 1 1/2 Sterne hat und viel mehr Luxus hat es auch nicht.Die Fahrstühle waren immer in Betrieb,im Foyer kann man für 10 $ am Tag ins Internet,was aber nicht nötig ist,da alle Cafe's im Umkreis free W-Lan haben,die Rezeption hilft bei Fragen und man kann neben dem Tresen auch alles buchen was man will von Bustouren über Tickets für Musicals eigentlich alles was man in NY unternehmen kann,will oder sollte.
Der 24-Stunden Shop der vom Hotel zu erreichen ist,hat alles was man für den kleinen Hunger und den großen Durst braucht,allerdings sind die Preise exorbitant und da Duane Reade(ein 24 Stunden Laden mit Nahrung,Kosmetik und Medikamenten) um die Ecke ist und auch vom Preis her NYCnormal sind wir dahin gegangen.
Fazit:wer nach NYC kommt und nur was zum schlafen und zum aufbewahren der Shoppingschätze sucht ist da sehr gut bedient.Wer nach deutschen Maßstäben rechnet und für wenig Geld(es gibt keine 10$ Hotels in Manhattan)super viel verlangt wird enttäuscht und schreibt am Ende böse Bewertungen.Wir sind auch nicht so jung,das wir uns mit jedem Zimmer,egal welchen Standard begnügen und somit fanden wir das Hotel einfach,angemessen und genial gelegen.
author: {'username': 'Annett M', 'num_cities': 4, 'num_helpful_votes': 7, 'num_reviews': 9, 'num_type_reviews': 4, 'id': 'B82E8F2FB4FF74D9918AA20F3AC24390', 'location': 'Berlin, Germany'}

title: “Un vrai bijou !”
text: Suivant les conseils de Trip Advisor, nous avons réservé la suite anglaise pour 3 nuits pour notre séjour à LA. Nous n'avons pas été déçus. Une suite spacieuse, très bien décorée et équipée ; une belle attention à notre arrivée (un gateau et du cidre), un endroit calme...tout était parfait mis à part quelques pbs de tuyauterie dans les toilettes mais vite réparés (avec des excuses parfaites de la part des propriétaires. La beauté des lieux dénote un peu avec l'environnement (pas terrible) mais nous ne nous sommes pas sentis en insécurité et le lieu est situé à quelques blocs à pied de walk of fame. C'est cher, mais l'endroit vaut certainement son prix.
author: {'username': 'CATLIE', 'num_cities': 17, 'num_helpful_votes': 17, 'num_reviews': 19, 'num_type_reviews': 17, 'id': '55E47A35D306D5CBD3D9F968631E7AE8', 'location': 'LA POSSESSION'}

title: “Winner & Why....”
text:
This hotel delivers exactly what one could ever ask for while visiting DC. Location is the greatest for seeing the sites. It sits just around the corner from the Metro station making getting anywhere else you choose to go around DC and suburbs very easy.They do cater to Corporate environment thus setting a high bar of professionalism. Nicola at front desk deserves a good mention here.
Let me start by mentioning the kiosk in lobby for the Hop on Hop Off tours.Run by Casey, a woman you just have to meet! Let's face it, Washington will be grueling on the feet, this service cuts out all the walking between sites as you can just " hop on and off" when you are ready to go somewhere else for days should you choose. (The Capitol to Lincoln memorial is 2 miles along the National Mall, to give a rough judgment call).. If you can do A LOT of walking, you will be able to get everywhere w/ no transportation costs at all from this location.Regular buses are very hard to navigate and there are no maps or such for the tourists and they are far and few between except for rush hour for the workers.Hop on/off buses are seen constantly running all parts of the mall and are much less expensive and more convenient than cabs if you can believe it! They will detail and meet your needs while visiting. They also own the store just down the small corridor off the lobby where you can get anything from a snack to luggage! Amazing what they fit in that store. They also provided me in a desperate hour with Wheel chair rental for a very reasonable price w/o having to contact a medical rental place and saved all the paperwork time/ proof of insurance etc! These people really do care about people, do not miss meeting them at least! :) The hotel is applauded for having their services right there in the lobby.
Our room on the 7th floor was amazingly clean, hats off to the housekeepers! They do start early so if sleeping in is something you want, use the do not disturb until your ready to leave. There are numerous housekeepers per floor so running back to the room you always find it ready and perfect for your return.
Being on the 7th floor, the water pressure and hot water availability was great and the shower heads are a dream.
There are 4 elevators and you never have to wait long to get one.
The black out curtains in the rooms are wonderful and large enough so no cracks of light anywhere.
The Handicapped button on door was not working and we were at the mercy of passers by for two days as the hotel was unaware. I trust they will now check this on a daily basis and they were sorry. 
The pool closes Labor Day Weekend for the season but failed to mention it on their site.
There is an outdoor Atrium off the lobby where one can sit & read, relax w a cocktail, and you can smoke without being banished to the front sidewalk. They do have smoking rooms for those who choose. It is tiered with trees etc, giving a very nice park feel even though you're surrounded by all concrete buildings. Could be swept more though to match the cleanliness of the rest of the hotel.
The cable channels were plenty for anyone and a free movie channel is supplied. In house movie ordering is available at $15.00, but we chose not to use. Free wi-fi great for checking times etc of museums.
There is one problem within room layout and that was the desk was right next to a/c unit, so if you will spend any significant time at the desk on the computer, you will need to wear a coat or move it or ask for an additional blanket to wrap around you as cords do not go too far.
There are three eateries on the premises, I can only comment on two. Capitol Bistro & 21st Amendment. Capitol Bistro has a breakfast buffet which is worth getting when you can eat all you want, selection is good,(do not skip the pears w/ cinnamon!) and all the juices and coffee you wish, making it a relatively great bargain verses an al a carte breakfast. Ask for Desta's section. Her smile and amazing grace will start your day off right. I felt privileged to meet her and we left with truly loving hugs.
The 21st Amendment had good menu selection, cocktails and live entertainment Thursday night. The prices are competitive to what you will pay in a museum during the day to eat a meal. After 5:00 p.m., it is far and few between to find food, but the location of hotel is great for this too. There are a few "fast food" places as exiting the hotel, turn right and stay on sidewalk.But take heed, they are not open past 8:00 p.m.There is also a CVS/pharmacy.
There is a Starbuck's next door you can access w/o having to leave the hotel at all through the lobby.
They have washers and dryers for use of guests at $2.00 per load, having to pack less was a dream as was saving the baggage fees at airport.Dryers did not dry a standard load when we were there though, hope they will tend to the problem which we did mention to them.
The pricing per night roller coaster you see on the internet is due to the corporate catering they tend to. Even calling for a price per night won't get you it as a tourist. It is what it is. It would be nice if they charged a median price per night for all nights for tourists, but in the end, a few hundred more for the location and cleanliness was worth it. It made for a convenient, relaxing,easy vacation w/ no worries.
Enjoyed our stay, would recommend to anyone without hesitation.

title: “The London is an excellent hotel.”
text: The London is an excellent hotel. Great location, wonderful rooms and quite beautiful. The bar was also a good experience. The check in and check process was efficent and quick. The staff is very accomodating. This is an excellent hotel to experience New York.
